result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jasmin Garcia not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Jasmin Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Requesting 30 days - set for trial if not resolved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jasmin Garcia in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Jasmin Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim also present in court. Defense just received an offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
*Since the defendant has not filed a similar request I'll hear this on 9/7. DSJ

ADDRESS INFO for Jasmin Garcia
Current: 197 Church St Apt A, Sharon, WI 53585 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2022)
Prior: 205 W Walworth St #5, Elkhorn, WI 53121
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jasmin Garcia in court. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Attorney Hagerman. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Renner. Argument, granted. Bond amended to no violent contact. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 7-20-2022 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH H.E.W. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. DEFENDANT TO PARTICIPATE IN THE WAY AT NEW BEGINNINGS OR EQUIVALENT. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH HEW OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

1:19 PM case called. Defendant Jasmin Garcia in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg for the State. Attorney Hagerman for bond purposes only. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Discussion as to bond. Victim not present. Bond set, $1000 RoR. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
